title: Creating MacOS Windows Installation Media
body:
## Download Windows 10

[Windows10 ISO](https://www.microsoft.com/ja- jp/software- download/windows10ISO)


## Create boot media

Double- click the ISO downloaded from the above site to mount it. Then run the script as follows

Sometimes GPT - > MBR will work.

```bash
$ # メディアのフォーマット
$ diskutil eraseDisk MS-DOS "WIN10" GPT /dev/disk4
$ # sources/install.wim以外のファイルを転送
$ rsync -avh --progress --exclude=sources/install.wim /Volumes/CCCOMA_X64FRE_JA-JP_DV9/ /Volumes/WIN10
$ # sources/install.wimを分割して書き込み
$ wimlib-imagex split /Volumes/CCCOMA_X64FRE_JA-JP_DV9/sources/install.wim /Volumes/WIN10/sources/install.swm 3200
$ # /dev/disk4のマウント解除
$ diskutil unmountDisk /dev/disk4
```

Change `/dev/disk4` to the directory of the corresponding external USB media. (You can check the currently connected disk information with `$ diskutil list`)
If you have not installed wimlib, run `$ brew install wimlib` to install it.

After execution, the procedure is identical to the normal Windows installation procedure.

## Impressions

I remember it was so easy to make with the dd command, but when did it get so complicated;.

It seems that this is happening because `install.wim` has exceeded the FAT32 limit (4GB) by more than 4GB.

I heard that the swm extension is used to split wim files, I've never heard of it before.
